examples.textEn: If you want to take advantage of the day, get up earlier.
examples.textEs: Si quieres aprovechar el día, levántate más temprano.

examples.textEn: They took advantage of the discount to buy Christmas presents.
examples.textEs: Aprovecharon el descuento para comprar los regalos de Navidad.

examples.textEn: I like to make the most of my vacation time.
examples.textEs: Me gusta aprovechar el tiempo que tengo de vacaciones.

examples.textEn: We knew how to make good use of the academy's facilities.
examples.textEs: Supimos aprovechar las instalaciones de la academia.

examplesDisplay: Si quieres aprovechar el día, levántate más temprano.
If you want to take advantage of the day, get up earlier.
Aprovecharon el descuento para comprar los regalos de Navidad.
They took advantage of the discount to buy Christmas presents.
Me gusta aprovechar el tiempo que tengo de vacaciones.
I like to make the most of my vacation time.
Supimos aprovechar las instalaciones de la academia.
We knew how to make good use of the academy's facilities.

examples.textEn: I used the break to buy the newspaper.
examples.textEs: Aproveché el descanso para comprar el periódico.

examplesDisplay: Aproveché el descanso para comprar el periódico.
I used the break to buy the newspaper.

tooltip.def: A transitive verb is a verb that requires a direct object (e.g. I bought a book.).

senses.contextEn: to make use of; often used with "para"

examples.textEn: The baby is asleep. Make the most of it and take a shower.
examples.textEs: El bebé está durmiendo; aprovecha y tómate una ducha.

translations.translation: to make the most of it

examples.textEn: Take the opportunity to travel the world while you're young.
examples.textEs: Aprovecha para viajar el mundo mientras seas joven.

senses.context: to make use of; often used with "para"

translationsDisplay.translation: to make the most of it

texts: to make the most of it

examplesDisplay: El bebé está durmiendo; aprovecha y tómate una ducha.
The baby is asleep. Make the most of it and take a shower.
Aprovecha para viajar el mundo mientras seas joven.
Take the opportunity to travel the world while you're young.

tooltip.def: An intransitive verb is one that does not require a direct object (e.g. The man sneezed.).

examples.textEn: She took advantage of the fact that they were foreigners to overcharge them.
examples.textEs: Se aprovechó de que eran extranjeros para cobrarles más.

examplesDisplay: Se aprovechó de que eran extranjeros para cobrarles más.
She took advantage of the fact that they were foreigners to overcharge them.

examples.textEn: He took her to an alley and took advantage of her.
examples.textEs: Se la llevó a un callejón y se aprovechó de ella.

examples.textEn: If a person abuses a child, he or she will go to jail.
examples.textEs: Si una persona se aprovecha de un niño, irá a la cárcel.

examplesDisplay: Se la llevó a un callejón y se aprovechó de ella.
He took her to an alley and took advantage of her.
Si una persona se aprovecha de un niño, irá a la cárcel.
If a person abuses a child, he or she will go to jail.

tooltip.def: A pronominal verb always uses a reflexive pronoun. (e.g. Te ves cansado.).

translations.translation: to use, to make use of

examples.textEs: me gustaría aprovechar esta oportunidad para…
examples.textEn: I'd like to take this opportunity to…
to make the most of the fact that…

translationsDisplay.translation: to use, to make use of

texts: to use, to make use of

examplesDisplay: me gustaría aprovechar esta oportunidad para…
I'd like to take this opportunity to…
aprovechar que…
to make the most of the fact that…

examples.textEs: no tires los restos de la paella, los aprovecharé para hacer sopa
examples.textEn: don't throw what's left of the paella away, I'll use it to make a soup

examplesDisplay: no tires los restos de la paella, los aprovecharé para hacer sopa
don't throw what's left of the paella away, I'll use it to make a soup

tooltip.def: A transitive verb is a verb that requires a direct object (e.g. I bought a book.).

examples.textEn: make the most of it o enjoy it while you can

examples.textEs: ¡cómo aprovechas para comer chocolate, ahora que no te ve nadie!
examples.textEn: you're really making the most of the opportunity to eat chocolate while nobody can see you!

tooltip.def: This refers to an idiomatic word or phrase for which there is no word-for-word translation.

examplesDisplay: aprovecha mientras puedas
make the most of it o enjoy it while you can
¡cómo aprovechas para comer chocolate, ahora que no te ve nadie!
you're really making the most of the opportunity to eat chocolate while nobody can see you!
¡que aproveche!
enjoy your meal!

tooltip.def: An intransitive verb is one that does not require a direct object (e.g. The man sneezed.).

examples.textEs: se aprovechó de que nadie vigilaba para salir sin pagar
examples.textEn: she took advantage of the fact that nobody was watching to leave without paying

examplesDisplay: se aprovechó de que nadie vigilaba para salir sin pagar
she took advantage of the fact that nobody was watching to leave without paying

examples.textEs: fue acusado de aprovecharse de una menor
examples.textEn: he was accused of child abuse

examplesDisplay: fue acusado de aprovecharse de una menor
he was accused of child abuse

tooltip.def: A pronominal verb always uses a reflexive pronoun. (e.g. Te ves cansado.).
